> The diff coverage is `84%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=BRfCKo02De&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff
========================================

========================================

- Misses       2421    2517     +96
```

| [toxcore/net\_crypto.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9uZXRfY3J5cHRvLmM=) | `94% <82.8%> (-1.3%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/crypto\_core\_test.cc](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9jcnlwdG9fY29yZV90ZXN0LmNj) | `90.6% <0%> (-9.4%)` | :arrow_down: |

| [toxcore/TCP\_server.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9UQ1Bfc2VydmVyLmM=) | `79.9% <0%> (-2.8%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [toxcore/TCP\_client.c](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-dG94Y29yZS9UQ1BfY2xpZW50LmM=) | `62.1% <0%> (-2.6%)` | :arrow_down: |
| ... and [7 more](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/diff?src=pr&el=tree-more) | |

------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [74fc646...6338cb4](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

crypto_kill is also called in various places in friend_connection.c, did 
you check that the locking isn't needed there either?

I see what you mean about copying mutexes to avoid deleting them being 
invalid, but the current behaviour of destroying a crypto_connection 
mutex only on reallocating is used in a few places, so just removing it 
like this breaks things. Namely: create_crypto_connection doesn't 
initialise a fresh mutex if no reallocation is needed, because it 
expects there to already be one, and in various places the status is set 
to CRYPTO_CONN_NO_CONNECTION without the mutex being destroyed, because 
it's expected that it will be destroyed on reallocation.

The rest looks good.

Reallocating structures with mutexes is also not going to work see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14614523/can-a-pthread-mutex-t-be-moved-in-memory so you found another area where fixes are needed :(

About `crypto_kill` you're right, I'll extract the part doing the actual cleanup and call that instead of `crypto_kill` in the appropriate part.

I dropped the changes for `crypto_kill`, because this needs more thought and probably some restructuring in `net_crypto.c`. It's also only a false positive as far as I can tell, because when `tox_kill` is called, no other threads are allowed to run anymore.

There seem to be a couple of problems with the new handling of 
conn->mutex. I find it most convenient to describe these by means of 
patches; I hope that's ok. Please see zugz/fix_tsan.

(A)  There are a couple of problems in create_crypto_connections (fixed 
in my branch referred to above):

1. The connections_mutex isn't locked in the first 'for' block, even 
though it is touching crypto_connections and the mutex is unlocked 
there.

2. The two malloc fail error paths don't unlock the mutex.


(B)  I would remove the comment
"// free memory before destroying the pointer to prevent a leak",
since it seems pretty obvious what the point of the free is.


(C)  I am rather worried that the mutex might be destroyed in 
wipe_crypto_connection while another thread is locking it. At least, 
I don't see any obvious proof that this won't happen. This bug, if bug 
it is, already existed -- but now you destroy more frequently, which 
might tickle it.


(D)  It doesn't seem to be clear that wipe_crypto_connection won't get 
called in crypto_kill on an already wiped connection, leading to 
a double-free.


One way to deal with these last two issues would be to never destroy or 
free these mutexes -- so never shrink crypto_connections, and as before 
just set status to CRYPTO_CONN_NO_CONNECTION to indicate that a slot and 
its mutex can be reused for a new connection. If I understand the code 
correctly, crypto_connections is only used for actual 
friend_connections, so this grow-only behaviour shouldn't introduce or 
worsen an attack vector. It's a little inelegant, but better than 
risking undefined behaviour.
I seem to break something with the last commit, need to investigate.
Checking the return value of `crypto_connection_status(...)` was causing test fails. Since it wasn't checked before I removed it again, but AFAICT this is a definite bug.

>> // REVIEW: are you sure we shouldn't set direct_connected and 
>> online_tcp_relays in this case anyway?
>
>No, I'm not sure, but before that the values weren't set on some exit 
>paths either, so I choose to keep it that way.

Previously they were set for all status values other than NO_CONNECTION. 

I haven't checked in detail, but it looks like this is important -- 
send_packet_to does get called for connections in other states, e.g. in 
handle_packet_connection.

So it looks like we should preserve this behaviour, i.e. return early 
only when conn==nullptr.
Changed it as you suggested. Note that the required check if the connection is initialized is already performed in `get_crypto_connection(...)`.

* Sunday, 2019-12-08 at 07:16 -0800 - sudden6 <notifications@github.com>:

>> // REVIEW: why was the test
>// (conn->status == CRYPTO_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
>// removed here by commit cab510a5c4c9c22038c7c767df0afbcaef7dce6c?
>
>This should be adressed by https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1346/commits/78c1736f1f9da3cbb12bf52cf9124e6775220b27

Not exactly, because crypto_connection_status returning true doesn't 
imply that the status is CRYPTO_CONN_ESTABLISHED. So probably this 
explicit test should be reintroduced in do_tcp. Also the documentation 
on crypto_connection_status is misleading.

I've gone through the whole PR again, and other than the above it all 
looks good.

One last little thing: I think you can now get rid of both the FIXMEs 
about checking the crypto_connection_status return value; in both cases, 
the tests for direct_connected and/or online_tcp_relays suffice.
IMO the FIXME's should stay, the whole `net_crypto` thing is quite inconsistent in its internal API with regards to return values, so if it's sanitized in the future I don't want to miss these.

commit.message:
fix invalid use of mutex

- Moving a pthread_mutex in memory (e.g. via realloc()) is undefined
  behavior.
- add a state for allocated but not yet used crypto connections
- change crypto_connection_status signature

verification.payload:
tree 07789a78fe147e8ffb183e38968cf5398fd4cd71
parent abfd90d25b38581db1e831ba5d1aba35c2d8147a
author sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1567807346 +0200
committer sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1577141295 +0100

fix invalid use of mutex

- Moving a pthread_mutex in memory (e.g. via realloc()) is undefined
  behavior.
- add a state for allocated but not yet used crypto connections
- change crypto_connection_status signature

title: Fix most TSAN failures
